Yes, </span><em>sub</em><span> $250mm. </span></p><p><span>February isnâ€™t exactly off to a rockinâ€™ start either. Yes, shockingly </span><strong>Zips Car Wash LLC</strong><span>, a PE roll-up of car wash businesses, accumulated roughly $644mm of term loans, and, yes, itâ€™s now in bankruptcy to pursue a plan of reorganization that will shed roughly $279mm of that $644mm off its balance sheet. But otherwise, the filings thus far in February have been lame as f*ck. That descriptor encompasses </span><strong>Liberated Brands LLC</strong><span>, too, but that didnâ€™t stop us from having some fun with it below. </span></p><p>In addition to that situation, today we spend some time discussing a recent executive order that might reverberate through the retail sector, addressing some recent filings, revisiting some old filings, and initiating coverage on a new name.
